017
018package org.tquadrat.foundation.fx;
019
020import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
021import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.isNull;
022import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
023
024import java.util.function.Function;
025
026import org.apiguardian.api.API;
027import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
028import org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.GenericStringConverter;
029import org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Stringer;
030
031/**
032 *  <p>{@summary An implementation of
033 *  {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.StringConverter}
034 *  that extends
035 *  {@link javafx.util.StringConverter}.}
036 *  It delegates the transformation work to the <i>Foundation</i>
037 *  {@code StringConverter} instance that is provided to the
038 *  {@link #FXStringConverter(org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.StringConverter) constructor}.</p>
039 *  <p>To reuse an existing JavaFX {@code StringConverter}, you can use the
040 *  method
041 *  {@link #wrap(javafx.util.StringConverter)}.</p>
042 *  <p>To get just a <i>Foundation</i> {@code StringConverter}, you can use
043 *  this code (here {@code BigInteger} is used as an example):</p>
044 *  <pre><code>
045 *      final var x = new BigIntegerStringConverter();
046 *      final var c = new GenericStringConverter&lt;BigInteger&gt;( s -> isNull( s ) ? null : x.fromString( s.toString() ), x::toString );
047 *  </code></pre>
048 *  <p>If you need to build a String converter from scratch that should serve
049 *  both purposes, write your own class that extends
050 *  {@link javafx.util.StringConverter}
051 *  and implements
052 *  {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.StringConverter},
053 *  and then implement the methods accordingly. Keep in mind that the method
054 *  signature for {@code fromString()} differs for both the abstract method and
055 *  the interface because of the different argument type (String vs.
056 *  CharSequence).</p>
057 *
058 *  @param <T>  The target type for the conversion.
059 *
060 *  @version $Id: FXStringConverter.java 984 2022-01-13 00:46:27Z tquadrat $
061 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
062 *  @UMLGraph.link
063 *  @since 0.1.0
064 *
065 *  @see GenericStringConverter
066 */
067@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: FXStringConverter.java 984 2022-01-13 00:46:27Z tquadrat $" )
068@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
069public final class FXStringConverter<T> extends javafx.util.StringConverter<T> implements org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.StringConverter<T>
070{
071        /*------------*\
072    ====** Attributes **=======================================================
073        \*------------*/
074    /**
075     *  The <i>Foundation</i>
076     *  {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.StringConverter StringConverter}
077     *  instance.
078     */
079    private final org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.StringConverter<T> m_StringConverter;
080
081        /*--------------*\
082    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
083        \*--------------*/
084    /**
085     *  Creates a new instance of {@code FXStringConverter}.
086     *
087     *  @param  stringConverter The <i>Foundation</i>
088     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.StringConverter StringConverter}
089     *      instance that does the work.
090     */
091    public FXStringConverter( final org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.StringConverter<T> stringConverter )
092    {
093        super();
094
095        m_StringConverter = requireNonNullArgument( stringConverter, "stringConverter" );
096    }   //  FXStringConverter()
097
098        /*---------*\
099    ====** Methods **==========================================================
100        \*---------*/
101    /**
102     *  {@inheritDoc}
103     */
104    @SuppressWarnings( "PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface" )
105    @Override
106    public final T fromString( final String source )
107    {
108        final var retValue = isNull( source ) ? null : fromString( (CharSequence) source );
109
110        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
111        return retValue;
112    }   //  fromString()
113
114    /**
115     *  {@inheritDoc}
116     */
117    @Override
118    public final T fromString( final CharSequence source )
119    {
120        final var retValue = isNull( source ) ? null : m_StringConverter.fromString( source );
121
122        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
123        return retValue;
124    }   //  fromString()
125
126    /**
127     *  {@inheritDoc}
128     */
129    @Override
130    public final String toString( final T source )
131    {
132        final var retValue = isNull( source ) ? null : m_StringConverter.toString( source );
133
134        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
135        return retValue;
136    }   //  toString()
137
138    /**
139     *  Creates an instance of {@code FXStringConverter} from an instance of
140     *  {@link javafx.util.StringConverter}.
141     *
142     *  @param  <C> The subject class.
143     *  @param  stringConverter The instance of
144     *      {@link javafx.util.StringConverter}.
145     *  @return The new instance.
146     */
147    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
148    public static final <C> FXStringConverter<C> wrap( final javafx.util.StringConverter<C> stringConverter )
149    {
150        final var stringer = (Stringer<C>) s -> isNull( s ) ? null : stringConverter.toString( s );
151        final var parser = (Function<CharSequence, C>) s -> isNull( s ) ? null : stringConverter.fromString( s.toString() );
152
153        final var converter = new GenericStringConverter<>( parser, stringer );
154
155        final var retValue = new FXStringConverter<>( converter );
156
157        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
158        return retValue;
159    }   //  wrap()
160}
161//  class FXStringConverter
162
163/*
164 *  End of File
165 */
